name: tasha shawl
notes:
read about my knitting adventures on [substack][2].

---------------------------------------------------------------------

after the whirlwind of the holidays, itâ€™s time for peaceful, calm, meditative, in-the-moment knitting. when i think of intentional crafting, i think of tasha tudor, one of the most influential women in my life. she is my inspiration for the tasha shawl.

calming colors, rhythmic slip-stitch sections , restful stockinette, a classic, functional triangular shape, understated warmth... 

here are the basic skills you will need to knit the tasha shawl:

long-tail cast on
knit
purl
slip stitch
bind off 
m1r and m1l increases
(yo) yarn over
purl through back loop
weave in ends as you go

main color: four 50g skeins blue sky fibers woolstok, colorway 1312 drift wood
contrast color: one 50g skein blue sky fibers woolstok, colorway 1324 morning frost
(50 g [1.76 oz] =  112 m [123 yds])

blocked gauge: 20 sts/ 24 rows = 4 inches (10 cm) square in slip stitch and stockinette stitch on 
5.0 mm [us8] needles or needle size needed to obtain gauge

wingspan: approximately 
178 cm [70"]
depth: approximately  69 cm [27"]


  [1]: https://ko-fi.com/carointhecity
  [2]: https://caroknitsinthecity.substack.com/
